Should designers code?

Jan 1, 2017

Yes. Designers who sit within a feature team gain large advantages if they can code. Here are three reasons why.

❶ Shared vocabulary

It creates a “shared vocabulary between engineering and design” ¹. When engineers talk about changes that need to be made and shipping fixes to customers, the design team are no longer left scratching their heads.

❷ Tickets are done quicker

Everyone does code reviews. Designers now get hands-on when reviewing pull requests, requesting and reviewing screenshots/gifs and sitting with engineers to desk-review implementations. They’re now creating their own pull requests 💪².

❸ Small changes are no longer blocked by busy engineers

I would be more effective if I didn’t have to wait for other people… …I ended up becoming more effective because I was able to ship the small things and fix bugs myself². Text changes. Translations file.


¹ Bryn Jackson, Design Details Podcast
² Lorcan Coyle, Shipping code for designers, not just engineers
